page.title: 15The Freshfield Shops (1)
page.content: Near Freshfield station are several shops including a baker's, a pet shop and a newsagent's. We visited a cafe, a garden centre and an aquarium too. The baker's had many types of bread. A large wholemeal loaf cost 52 pence. The pet shop had 4 mice, 4 fish, a bird and a rabbit for sale. The news- agent's sold Lyons Maid ice-cream. The most expensive ice-cream was the Super Triple Choc at 40p. The cheapest ice- lolly was a 'Mr.Men' at 11p. The cafe sold Walls' ice-cream. The most expensive ice-creams here were the Choc 'n' Nut, Strawberry Ripple and Cream of Cornish family packs at 80p. The garden centre sold many plants including herbs such as borage, woad and gold-tipped marjoram. The aquarium sold fish and water-life. The man gave us some water snails which should have been Â£1 for 8.
